intro: Psorospermum chevalieri, commonly known as the Madagascar ebony, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, black, fleshy fruits. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
